articles.description: Airlines are limited in how much they can raise fares as they chase passengers returning to the skies.
articles.content: Airlines trying to claw their way out of two bruising pandemic years are now facing the most expensive jet fuel costs in more than 13 years, overshadowing a recent jump in travel demand and sending s… [+3138 chars]

articles.author: Al Root
articles.title: Boeing Might Have a Russian Titanium Problem - Barron's
articles.description: A lot of titanium metal ends up on modern jets. Much of it is supplied from Russia, though the company says it has enough of the metal.
articles.content:
There is a lot of lightweight, ultrastrong titanium metal in modern jet planes. Titanium cuts weight and improves fuel efficiency. Thats the good news. 
The bad news is that Russia is a big supplier… [+258 chars]
